class="cell-u1#b">SELECT * FROM user;</td></tr><tr id="e269d0a9-783f-4cf7-88cb-4a30757ef04f"><td class="cell-title"><a href="https://www.notion.so/DISTINCT-e269d0a9783f4cf788cb4a30757ef04f">DISTINCT</a></td><td class="cell-,=T>">Get unique values from column</td><td class="cell-Fqs&amp;">SELECT DISTINCT column FROM table;</td><td class="cell-u1#b">SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT rating) FROM film;</td></tr><tr id="05563dcc-d7e0-4c0c-a02a-d85db9774042"><td class="cell-title"><a href="https://www.notion.so/WHERE-05563dccd7e04c0ca02ad85db9774042">WHERE</a></td><td class="cell-,=T>">Specifies conditions on columns for the rows to be turned</td><td class="cell-Fqs&amp;">SELECT column FROM table WHERE condition;</td><td class="cell-u1#b">SELECT email FROM customer WHERE first_name = 'Nancy' AND last_name = 'Thomas';</td></tr><tr id="84ba9cbe-694a-436f-ad3f-3eea735423c6"><td class="cell-title"><a href="https://www.notion.so/ORDER-BY-84ba9cbe694a436fad3f3eea735423c6">ORDER BY</a></td><td class="cell-,=T>">Order table by column</td><td class="cell-Fqs&amp;">SELECT column_1,column_2 FROM table ORDER BY column_1 ASC / DESC;</td><td class="cell-u1#b">SELECT employee FROM table ORDER BY company ASC,sales DESC,employee ASC;</td></tr><tr id="74b6ac2b-ec6b-4007-99a0-5af7bebb7b8c"><td class="cell-title"><a href="https://www.notion.so/LIMIT-74b6ac2bec6b400799a05af7bebb7b8c">LIMIT</a></td><td class="cell-,=T>">Set the max number of rows</td><td class="cell-Fqs&amp;">SELECT column FROM table ... LIMIT number_of_rows;</td><td class="cell-u1#b">SELECT payment FROM employee ORDER BY payment_date DESC LIMIT 5;</td></tr><tr id="5d12c47c-3aef-4656-ae00-4fc8b6449be2"><td class="cell-title"><a href="https://www.notion.so/BETWEEN-5d12c47c3aef4656ae004fc8b6449be2">BETWEEN</a></td><td class="cell-,=T>">Get values between a low and a high. It's the same as value &gt; = low AND value &lt; = high. Obs.: when you are dealing with dates, you need to be aware that it starts and finishes counting on 00:00h</td><td class="cell-Fqs&amp;">SELECT column FROM table BETWEEN low AND high;</td><td class="cell-u1#b">SELECT payment FROM employee BETWEEN '2007-01-01' AND '2007-02-01';</td></tr><tr id="8de91696-e430-4da6-b61a-dba936e60ea8"><td class="cell-title"><a href="https://www.notion.so/IN-8de91696e4304da6b61adba936e60ea8">IN</a></td><td class="cell-,=T>">Checks if a value is included in a list of multiple conditions. It's a short syntax for multiple OR statements</td><td class="cell-Fqs&amp;">SELECT column FROM table WHERE IN(condition_1, condition_2, ...) ;</td><td class="cell-u1#b">SELECT tint FROM shop WHERE tone IN('red','blue','pink');</td></tr><tr id="21462ce7-9639-47cb-a360-ae313a390850"><td class="cell-title"><a href="https://www.notion.so/GROUP-BY-21462ce7963947cba360ae313a390850">GROUP BY</a></td><td class="cell-,=T>">Aggregates columns per some category</td><td class="cell-Fqs&amp;">SELECT category_col, AGG(data_col) FROM table GROUP BY category_col;</td><td class="cell-u1#b">SELECT customer_id, company, SUM(amount) FROM payment GROUP BY customer_id, company ORDER BY SUM(amount) DESC;</td></tr><tr id="6e9d9aef-c783-41ae-a968-73a9db408a6b"><td class="cell-title"><a href="https://www.notion.so/HAVING-6e9d9aefc78341aea96873a9db408a6b">HAVING</a></td><td class="cell-,=T>">It works as a second WHERE, after GROUP BY using an aggregate function</td><td class="cell-Fqs&amp;">SELECT category_col, AGG(data_col) FROM table WHERE condition GROUP BY category_col HAVING condition_with_agg;</td><td class="cell-u1#b">SELECT company, SUM(sales) FROM finance_table WHERE company ! = 'Google' GROUP BY company HAVING SUM(sales) &gt; 1000</td></tr><tr id="a88b70f9-edc2-45b9-b4e5-8854934f4a20"><td class="cell-title"><a href="https://www.notion.so/AS-a88b70f9edc245b9b4e58854934f4a20">AS</a></td><td class="cell-,=T>">It renames some column</td><td class="cell-Fqs&amp;">SELECT column  AS new_column_name FROM table;</td><td class="cell-u1#b">SELECT AVG(amount) AS average_salary FROM payment;</td></tr></tbody></table></div><p id="63d16148-1040-4214-8387-a4e496db904e" class="">
</p><h2 id="b769935b-86bc-445f-9737-378cf9c372fe" class="">PATTERN MATCHING</h2><p id="bb3b59eb-c578-4d60-82f0-abe48600893c" class="">The <strong>LIKE</strong> and <strong>ILIKE</strong> operators allow us to perform pattern matching against string data with the use of <strong>wildcard</strong> characters</p><p id="3658bf86-781a-4fe1-8685-3fefb8846d86" class="">

filling with null logins with clients not registered and registrations that have never loged in</td><td class="cell-BL[Q">Opposite result of INNER JOIN: SELECT * FROM table1 OUTER JOIN table2 ON table1.col_to_match = table2.col_to_match WHERE table1.id IS null OR table2.id IS null;</td></tr><tr id="e34e68a1-2665-4ad4-8289-f739a2a43748"><td class="cell-title"><a href="https://www.notion.so/LEFT-OUTER-JOIN-or-LEFT-JOIN-e34e68a126654ad48289f739a2a43748">LEFT OUTER JOIN or LEFT JOIN</a></td><td class="cell-s(?y">Returns all records from the left table (table1), and the matched records from the right table (table2). The result is null from the right side, if there is no match.</td><td class="cell-pZMq">SELECT * FROM table1 LEFT OUTER JOIN table2 ON table1.col_to_match = table2.col_to_match;</td><td class="cell-?::C">SELECT * FROM registrations LEFT JOIN logins ON registrations.email = logins.email;</td><td class="cell-A?'~">A table with all registrations with their login data, filling with null registrations that have never loged in</td><td class="cell-BL[Q">Only unique entries from table1 (inside table1 and not found in table2): SELECT * FROM table1 LEFT JOIN table2 ON table1.col_to_match = table2.col_to_match WHERE table2.id IS null;</td></tr><tr id="f2321e8a-99fb-4add-b5d6-3cdc38fac1f7"><td class="cell-title"><a href="https://www.notion.so/RIGHT-OUTER-JOIN-or-RIGHT-JOIN-f2321e8a99fb4addb5d63cdc38fac1f7">RIGHT OUTER JOIN or RIGHT JOIN</a></td><td class="cell-s(?y">Returns all records from the right table (table2), and the matched records from the left table (table1). The result is null from the left side, when there is no match.</td><td class="cell-pZMq">SELECT * FROM table1 RIGHT OUTER JOIN table2 ON table1.col_to_match = table2.col_to_match;</td><td class="cell-?::C">SELECT * FROM registrations RIGHT JOIN logins ON registrations.email = logins.email;</td><td class="cell-A?'~">A table with all logins with their registrations data, filling with null logins that have never being registered</td><td class="cell-BL[Q">Only unique entries from table2 (inside table2 and not found in table1): SELECT * FROM table1 RIGHT JOIN table2 ON table1.col_to_match = table2.col_to_match WHERE table1.id IS null;</td></tr></tbody></table></div><p id="70916452-8d75-4011-abeb-2504212950ac" class="">
